subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Now if we died with Christ, we believe that we will also live with Him. For we know that since Christ was raised from the dead, He can not die again; death no longer has mastery over Him. . (Romans 6:8, 9) NIV
reflection: Because of Christ's death and resurrection, His followers need never fear death. That assurance frees us to enjoy fellowship with Him and to do His will. This will affect all our activities, work and worship, play, Bible study, quiet times, and times of caring for others. When you know that you do not have to fear death, you will experience a new feel for life.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the gift of fellowship, that I have with Jesus Christ. I thank You that death is no longer something I need to fear. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Our Christian hope is that one day we will live with the Lord...

Our Meditation for Monday:

Now if we died with Christ, we believe that we will 
also live with Him.

For we know that since Christ was raised from the 
dead , He can not die again; death no longer has
mastery over Him..(Ro. 6:8, 9) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Because of Christ's death and resurrection, His followers
need never fear death. That assurance frees us to enjoy 
fellowship with Him and to do His will...

This will affect all our activities, work and worship, play, Bible
study, quiet times, and times of caring for others...

When you know that you do not have to fear death, you will
experience a new feel for life...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the gift of fellowship,
that I have with Jesus Christ. I thank You that death is no longer
something I need to fear...Amen.

Keep looking up, He seeks to have fellowship with you...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The death He died, He died to sin once for all; but the life He lives, He lives to God. In the same way, count yourselves dead to sin but alive to God in Christ Jesus. (Romans 6:10, 11 NIV
reflection: To "Consider yourselves dead to sin" means that we should regard our old sinful nature as dead and unresponsive to sin. Because of our union and identification with Christ, we no longer want to pursue our old plans, desires, and goals. Now we want to live for the glory of God. As we start this new life, the Holy Spirit will help us become all that Christ wants us to be. Just remember to pray each morning that, 'today' you will be more sensitive to His leading and guiding.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me of my sins of thought, word, and deed. Help me to be more sensitive to Your Holy Spirit's leading and guiding. I ask that You will keep our nation, citizens, and troops safe. Bless my friends with safety and good health. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~This is Tue. Devo. in case I don't get back 
from Moorhead before Tue morning...

Our Meditation for Tue:

The death He died, He died to sin once for all; 
but the life He lives, He lives to God.

In the same way, count yourselves dead to sin
but alive to God in Christ Jesus...(Ro. 6:10, 11 NIV

Our Thought for Tue.

To "Consider yourselves dead to sin" means that we should
regard our old sinful nature as dead and unresponsive to sin...

Because of our union and identification with Christ, we no longer
want to pursue our old plans, desires, and goals...

Now we want to live for the glory of God. As we start this new life,
the Holy Spirit will help us become all that Christ wants us to be...

Just remember to pray each morning that, 'today' you will be more
sensitive to His leading and guiding...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me of my sins of thought,
word, and deed...Help me to be more sensitive to Your
Holy Spirit's leading and guiding. I ask that You will keep
our nation, citizens, and troops safe. Bless my e-mail
friends with safety and good health...Amen.

Keep looking up, He is the answer to your prayers...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Sin shall not be your master, because you are not under the law, but under grace. What then? shall we sin because we are not under the law but under grace? By no means! (Romans 6:14, 15) NIV
reflection: If we are no longer under the law but under grace, are we now free to sin and disregard the Ten Commandments? Paul says, "Of course not!" When we were under the law, sin was our master--the law does not justify us or help us overcome sin. But now we are bound to Christ, He is our Master, and He gives us power to do good rather than evil.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You would convict me of my sins when I use excuses why it is all right to go against Your will. I pray for added power to be able to abstain from sin and thus only do what is right. I pray that You will keep our Nation, its citizens, and our troops safe. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Life is what we make it, Always has been~~~Always will be.

Our Meditation for Today:

Sin shall not be your master, because you are not under
the law, but under grace...

What then? shall we sin because we are not under the law 
but under grace? By no means! (Ro. 6:14, 15) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

If we are no longer under the law but under grace, are we now
free to sin and disregard the Ten Commandments?

Paul says, "Of course not!"

When we were under the law, sin was our master--the law does 
not justify us or help us overcome sin...

But now we are bound to Christ, He is our Master, and He gives 
us power to do good rather than evil.

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You would convict 
me of my sins when I use excuses why it is all right 
to go against Your will. I pray for added power to be 
able to abstain from sin and thus only do what is right.
I pray that You will keep our Nation, its citizens, and
our troops safe...Amen.

Keep looking up, He has the power...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Don't you know that when you offer yourselves to someone to obey him as slaves, you are slaves to the one whom you obey~~whether you are slaves to sin, which leads to death, or to obedience, which leads to righteousness? But thanks be to God that, though you used to be slaves to sin, you whole heatedly obeyed the form of teaching to which you were entrusted. You have been set free from sin and have become slaves to righteousness. (Romans 6:16-18) NIV
reflection: All people have one master or another and they pattern themselves after him. Without Jesus, we would have no choice, we would be enslaved to sin, and the result would be guilt, suffering, and separation from God. Thanks to Jesus, however, we can now choose God as our Master. Following Him, we can enjoy new life and learn how to work for Him. Are you still serving your first master sin? Or have you chosen God?
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I can not thank You enough for the wonderful gift of salvation that is ours in Christ Jesus. I pray that You will guide me in paths of righteousness. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~When you can't sleep at night , don't count sheep~~~talk to the shepherd.

Our Meditation for Today:

Don't you know that when you offer yourselves to someone 
to obey him as slaves, you are slaves to the one whom you
obey~~whether you are slaves to sin, which leads to death, or
to obedience, which leads to righteousness?

But thanks be to God that, though you used to be slaves to sin,
you whole heatedly obeyed the form of teaching to which you 
were entrusted.

You have been set free from sin and have become slaves to 
righteousness...(Ro. 6:16-18) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

All people have one master or another and they pattern themselves
after him...

Without Jesus, we would have no choice, we would be enslaved to sin, 
and the result would be guilt, suffering, and separation from God...

Thanks to Jesus, however, we can now choose God as our Master.
Following Him, we can enjoy new life and learn how to work for Him...

Are you still serving your first master sin?
Or have you chosen God?

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I can not thank You enough for the 
wonderful gift of salvation that is ours in Christ Jesus. I pray
that You will guide me in paths of righteousness...Amen.

Keep looking up, in Him all things are possible...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I put this in human terms because you are weak in your natural selves. Just as you used to offer the parts of your body in slavery to impurity and to ever-increasing wickedness, so now offer them in slavery to righteousness leading to holiness. When you were slaves to sin, you were free from the control of righteousness. What benefit did you reap at that time from the things you are now ashamed of? Those things result in death! But now that you have been set free from sin and have become slaves to God, the benefit you reap leads to holiness, and the result is eternal life. (Romans 6:19-22) NIV
reflection: It is impossible to be neutral. Every person has a master, either God or sin. A Christian is not someone who can not sin but someone who is no longer a slave to sin. He or she belongs to God.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, each and every day I need to look to You for the strength and power to turn from those old sinful ways and to be more faithful to You. Give me the power again today. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~God wants to give you the power to obey...

Our Meditation for Today:

I put this in human terms because you are weak in your natural
selves. Just as you used to offer the parts of your body in slavery 
to impurity and to ever-increasing wickedness, so now offer them 
in slavery to righteousness leading to holiness...

When you were slaves to sin, you were free from the control of
righteousness.

What benefit did you reap at that time from the things you are 
now ashamed of? Those things result in death!

But now that you have been set free from sin and have become 
slaves to God, the benefit you reap leads to holiness, and the
result is eternal life...(Ro. 6:19-22) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

It is impossible to be neutral. Every person has a master, either
God or sin.

A Christian is not someone who can not sin but someone who is 
no longer a slave to sin. He or she belongs to God...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, each and every day I need to 
look to You for the strength and power to turn from
those old sinful ways and to be more faithful to You.
Give me the power again today...Amen.

Keep looking up, God does not ignore those who depend on Him...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: For the wages of sin is death, but the gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord. (Romans 6:23) NIV
reflection: Yes we are free to choose between two masters, sin or Christ Jesus. BUT the wages of sin is eternal death. That is all you can expect or hope for in a life without God. By choosing Christ as your master, you receive His gift of eternal life~~new life with God that begins on earth and continues forever with God. What choice have you made??? We need to remember, eternal life is a gift from God. AND if it is a gift, then it is not something that we can earn, nor something that must be paid for. Consider the foolishness of someone who receives a gift given out of love and then offers to pay for it. A gift cannot be purchased by the recipient. A more appropriate response to a loved one who offers a gift is graceful acceptance with gratitude.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I cannot thank You enough for the wonderful gift of salvation, made possible by Your Son Jesus Christ. I pray that You would give me a more faithful heart. My request today is that You would keep our nation, its citizens and our troops safe. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~Christ is the only way

Our Meditation for Today:

For the wages of sin is death, but the gift of God
is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord...(Ro. 6:23) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Yes we are free to choose between two masters, sin or Christ Jesus.
BUT the wages of sin is eternal death...

That is all you can expect or hope for in a life without God...

By choosing Christ as your master, you receive His gift of eternal
life~~new life with God that begins on earth and continues forever
with God...

What choice have you made???

We need to remember, eternal life is a gift from God. AND if it is a gift, 
then it is not something that we can earn, nor something that must be 
paid for...

Consider the foolishness of someone who receives a gift given out of
love and then offers to pay for it...

A gift cannot be purchased by the recipient. A more appropriate response
to a loved one who offers a gift is graceful acceptance with gratitude...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I cannot thank You enough for the 
wonderful gift of salvation, made possible by Your Son 
Jesus Christ. I pray that You would give me a more 
faithful heart. My request today is that You would 
keep our nation, its citizens and our troops safe...Amen.

Keep looking up, He will sustain you...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Do you not know, brothers for I am speaking to men who know the law~ that the law has authority over a man only as long as he lives? For, example, by law a married woman is bound to her husband as long as he is alive, but if her husband dies, she is released from the law of marriage. So then, if she marries another man while her husband is still alive, she is called an adulteress. But if her husband dies, she is released from that law and is not an adulteress, even though she marries another man. (John 7:1-3) NIV
reflection: Paul uses marriage to illustrate our relationship to the law. When a spouse dies, the law of marriage no longer applies. Because we have died with Christ, the law can no longer condemn us. Since we are united with Christ, His spirit enables us to produce good deeds for God. We now serve God, not by obeying a set of rules, but out of renewed hearts and minds that overflow with love for Him.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I have so often strayed from Your side, forgive me for this sin of returning to my old nature. Renew a right spirit within me, cleanse me from all unrighteousness, I pray this in Jesus Name Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~No matter who we are only Jesus can set us free...

Our Meditation for Today:

Do you not know, brothers for I am speaking to men who know the law~
that the law has authority over a man only as long as he lives?

For, example, by law a married woman is bound to her husband as long
as he is alive, but if her husband dies, she is released from the law of marriage.

So then, if she marries another man while her husband is still alive, she is
called an adulteress. But if her husband dies, she is released from that law
and is not an adulteress, even though she marries another man...(Jn. 7:1-3) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Paul uses marriage to illustrate our relationship to the law...

When a spouse dies, the law of marriage no longer applies.
Because we have died with Christ, the law can no longer condemn us.

Since we are united with Christ, His spirit enables us to produce good 
deeds for God. We now serve God, not by obeying a set of rules,
but out of renewed hearts and minds that overflow with love for Him...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I have so often strayed from Your
side, forgive me for this sin of returning to my old nature.
Renew a right spirit within me, cleanse me from all 
unrighteousness, I pray this in Jesus Name Amen...

Keep looking up, to the light...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: So my brothers, you also died to the law through the body of Christ, that you might belong to another, to Him who was raised from the dead, in order that we might bear fruit to God. (Romans 7:4) NIV
reflection: When a person dies to the old life and accepts Christ as Savior, a new life begins. An unbeliever's life is centered on his or her own personal gratification. Those who do not follow Christ have only their own self-determination as their source of power. Now by contrast, God is at the center of a Christian's life. God supplies the power for a Christian's daily living. Believers find that their whole way of looking at the world changes when they come to Christ.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the new life that You provide for those who believe. I thank You for How You provide the power to walk in the Light when temptations surround us. You have given us so much to be thankful for, forgive me when I complain about the little trials of life. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Given the chance the Holy Spirit will
enable us to do good deeds for God...

Our Meditation for Today:

So my brothers, you also died to the law through the body
of Christ, that you might belong to another, to Him who was 
raised from the dead, in order that we might bear fruit to God...
(Ro. 7:4) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

When a person dies to the old life and accepts Christ as Savior,
a new life begins...

An unbeliever's life is centered on his or her own personal gratification...

Those who do not follow Christ have only their own self-determination
as their source of power...

Now by contrast, God is at the center of a Christian's life.
God supplies the power for a Christian's daily living...

Believers find that their whole way of looking at the world
changes when they come to Christ...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the new life
that You provide for those who believe. I thank You
for How You provide the power to walk in the Light
when temptations surround us. You have given us so 
much to be thankful for, forgive me when I complain
about the little trials of life...Amen.

Keep looking up, for the power to overcome...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: But now, by dying to what once bound us, we have been released from the law so that we serve in a new way of the Spirit, and not in the old way of the written code. (Romans 7:6) NIV
reflection: Some people think they have earned their way to heaven be living a good and respectful life. But often all they have earned for their efforts is frustration and discouragement. However because of Christ's sacrifice, the way to God is already open, and we can become His children simply by putting our faith in Him. We no longer need to try to reach God by keeping rules, we can become more and more like Jesus as we live for Him day by day. We need to allow the Holy Spirit to turn our eyes away from our own performance and toward Jesus. He will free us to serve Him out of love and gratitude. This is known as living "In the new way, by the Spirit".
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I know that I can not earn my own way to Your heavenly kingdom, but I still often need help, to turn my eyes away from my own performance and to turn them to Jesus Christ. Keep our nation, its citizens and our troops safe. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~The result of sinful deeds is an eternal death...

Our Meditation for Today:

But now, by dying to what once bound us, we have been
released from the law so that we serve in a new way of
the Spirit, and not in the old way of the written code...(Ro. 7:6) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Some people think they have earned their way to heaven be living
a good and respectful life...

But often all they have earned for their efforts is frustration and
discouragement...

However because of Christ's sacrifice, the way to God is already open,
and we can become His children simply by putting our faith in Him.

We no longer need to try to reach God by keeping rules, we can become 
more and more like Jesus as we live for Him day by day...

We need to allow the Holy Spirit to turn our eyes away from our own 
performance and toward Jesus. He will free us to serve Him out of 
love and gratitude...

This is known as living "In the new way, by the Spirit".

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I know that I can not earn my own way 
to Your heavenly kingdom, but I still often need help, to turn 
my eyes away from my own performance and to turn them to 
Jesus Christ...Keep our nation, its citizens and our troops safe...Amen.

Keep looking up, in an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Once I was alive apart from the law; but when the commandment came, sin sprang to life and I died. I found that the very commandment that was intended to bring life actually brought death. (Romans 7:9, 10) NIV
reflection: When we say, "Where there is no law, there is no sin, " what we mean is, people cannot know their actions are sinful unless they have a law that forbids those actions. God's law makes people realize that they are sinners doomed to die, yet it offers no help. Sin is real, and it is dangerous. Imagine a sunny day at the beach. You plunge into the surf, then you notice a sign on the pier: "No swimming, sharks." Your day is ruined. Is it the signs fault? Are you angry with the people who put it up? The law is like the sign. It is essential, and we are grateful for it~~but it does not get rid of the sharks.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for pointing out my sins through the law. Help me to become more sensitive to my unfaithfulness. Guide and direct me I pray. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Be careful sin has a heavy handed grasp

Our Meditation for Today:

Once I was alive apart from the law; but when the commandment
came, sin sprang to life and I died...

I found that the very commandment that was intended to bring life 
actually brought death...(Ro. 7:9, 10) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

When we say, "Where there is no law, there is no sin," what we mean is,
people cannot know their actions are sinful unless they have a law that
forbids those actions...

God's law makes people realize that they are sinners doomed to die,
yet it offers no help...

Sin is real, and it is dangerous...

Imagine a sunny day at the beach. You plunge into the surf, then you
notice a sign on the pier: "No swimming, sharks..." Your day is ruined.

Is it the signs fault? Are you angry with the people who put it up?

The law is like the sign. It is essential, and we are grateful for it~~but
it does not get rid of the sharks...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for pointing out 
my sins through the law. Help me to become more 
sensitive to my unfaithfulness...Guide and direct me
I pray...Amen.


Keep looking up, in recognition of His greatness...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: For sin seizing the opportunity afforded by the commandment, deceived me, and through the commandment put me to death. So then, the law is holy, and the commandment is holy, righteous and good. (Romans 7:11, 12) NIV
reflection: Sin can deceive people by misleading them by the law. the law was holy, expressing God's nature and will for the people. In the Garden of Eden (Genesis 3), the serpent deceived Eve, changing her focus from the freedom she had to one restriction God had made. Ever since then we have all been rebels. Sin looks good to us precisely because God has said it is wrong. Instead of paying attention to His warnings, we use them as the "to do" list. When we are tempted to rebel, we need to look at the law from a wider perceptive~~in the light of God's grace and mercy. If we focus on His great love for us, we will understand that He only restricts from actions and attitudes that harm us.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You will forgive me because I have, and I am sure I will again, stray from the truth. Lord, instill in me a heart of obedience and love. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~There is no big or little sin, any size sin is spelled s-i-n.

Our Meditation for Today:

For sin seizing the opportunity afforded by the commandment,
deceived me, and through the commandment put me to death.

So then, the law is holy, and the commandment is holy, righteous 
and good...(Ro. 7:11, 12) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Sin can deceive people by misleading them by the law...
the law was holy, expressing God's nature and will for the
people...


In the Garden of Eden (Gen. 3), the serpent deceived Eve,
changing her focus from the freedom she had to one
restriction God had made...

Ever since then we have all been rebels. Sin looks good to us
precisely because God has said it is wrong...

Instead of paying attention to His warnings, we use them as the 
"to do" list. When we are tempted to rebel, we need to look at 
the law from a wider perceptive~~in the light of God's grace
and mercy...

If we focus on His great love for us, we will understand that
He only restricts from actions and attitudes that harm us...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You will forgive me because
I have, and I am sure I will again, stray from the truth. Lord,
instill in me a heart of obedience and love...Amen.

Keep looking up, He is sufficient in all things...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I Do not understand what I do. for what I want to do I do not do, but what I hate I do. (Romans 7:15) NIV
reflection: Being born again takes a moment of faith, but becoming like Christ is a lifelong process. As Paul has been emphasizing since the beginning of this letter no one in the world is innocent. No one deserves to be saved, not the pagan who doesn't know God's laws, not the Christian or Jew who knows them and tries to keep them. All of us must depend totally on the work of Christ for our salvation. we can not earn it by our good behavior.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me for my wayward ways. Guide me in paths of righteousness for Your name sake. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Becoming a Christian does not stamp out all sin...

Our Meditation for Today:

I Do not understand what I do. for what I want to do
I do not do, but what I hate I do...(Ro. 7:15) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Being born again takes a moment of faith, but becoming like Christ
is a life-long process...

As Paul has been emphasizing since the beginning of this letter no
one in the world is innocent...

No one deserves to be saved, not the pagan who doesn't know 
God's laws, not the Christian or Jew who knows them and tries to 
keep them...

All of us must depend totally on the work of Christ for our salvation.
we can not earn it by our good behavior...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me for my wayward ways.
Guide me in paths of righteousness for Your name sake...Amen.

Keep looking up, He is our guide and protector...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: As it is, it is no longer I myself who do it, but it is sin living in me. I know that noting good lives in me, that is, in my sinful nature. For I have the desire to do good, but I cannot carry it out. For what I do is not the good I want to do; no, the evil I do not want to do, this I keep on doing. Now if I do what I do not want to do, it is no longer I who do it, but it is sin living in me that does it. (Romans 7:17-20) NIV
reflection: How many times have you heard someone say, or even ourselves, "The devil made me do it." "I didn't do it; the sin within me did it." These sound like good excuses for sin, but we are responsible for our actions. We must never use the power of sin or Satan as an excuse, because they are defeated enemies. Without Christ's help, sin is stronger than we are, and sometimes we are unable to defend ourselves against his attacks. That is why we should not stand up to temptation alone. Jesus Christ who has conquered sin once for all, promises to fight by our side. If we look to Him for help, we will not have to give in to sin.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, Satan is forever prowling about like a roaring lion. I pray that You will remain by my side so that I can stand fast against temptation. You are my hiding place. I pray for good health and safety for all my e-mail friends Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~The old flesh continues to lift it's ugly head...

Our Meditation for Today:

As it is, it is no longer I myself who do it, but it is sin 
living in me...

I know that noting good lives in me, that is, in my sinful
nature. For I have the desire to do good, but I cannot 
carry it out...

For what I do is not the good I want to do; no, the evil
I do not want to do, this I keep on doing...

Now if I do what I do not want to do, it is no longer I who
do it, but it is sin living in me that does it...(Ro. 7:17-20) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

How many times have you heard someone say, or even ourselves,
"The devil made me do it." "I didn't do it; the sin within me did it."

These sound like good excuses for sin, but we are responsible for 
our actions...

We must never use the power of sin or Satan as an excuse, 
because they are defeated enemies...

Without Christ's help, sin is stronger than we are, and sometimes
we are unable to defend ourselves against his attacks. That is why 
we should not stand up to temptation alone...

Jesus Christ who has conquered sin once for all, promises to fight
by our side. If we look to Him for help, we will not have to give in to sin...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, Satan is forever prowling about 
like a roaring lion. I pray that You will remain by my side
so that I can stand fast against temptation. You are my
hiding place. I pray for good health and safety for all my
e-mail friends Amen....

Keep looking up, He is our help in all troubles...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I see another law at work in the members of my body, waging war against the law of my mind and making me a prisoner of the law of sin at work within my members. What a wretched man I am! Who will rescue me from this body of death? Thanks be to God~~through Jesus Christ our Lord! So then, I myself in my mind am a slave to God's law, but in the sinful nature a slave to the law of sin. (Romans 7:23-25) NIV
reflection: The "law at work within" is the sin nature deep within us. This is our vulnerability to sin; it refers to everything within us that is more loyal to our old way of selfish living than to God. This inward struggle with sin was as real to Paul as it is to us. We can learn what to do about it from Paul. Whenever Paul felt lost, he returned to the beginning of his spiritual life, remembering that he had already been freed by Jesus Christ. When we feel confused and overwhelmed by sin's appeal, we need to follow Paul's example: Thank God that He has given us freedom through Jesus Christ. We need to let the reality of Christ's power to lift us up to real victory over sin.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the power to overcome sin through Your Son Jesus Christ. Help me to remember to turn to Him each day when the sin problem returns. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~The answer to our sin problem is Jesus Christ...

Our Meditation for Today:

I see another law at work in the members of my body, 
waging war against the law of my mind and making me
a prisoner of the law of sin at work within my members.

What a wretched man I am! Who will rescue me from
this body of death?

Thanks be to God~~through Jesus Christ our Lord! So
then, I myself in my mind am a slave to God's law, but 
in the sinful nature a slave to the law of sin...(Ro. 7:23-25) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

The "law at work within" is the sin nature deep within us.
This is our vulnerability to sin; it refers to everything within
us that is more loyal to our old way of selfish living than
to God...

This inward struggle with sin was as real to Paul as it is 
to us. We can learn what to do about it from Paul...

Whenever Paul felt lost, he returned to the beginning of 
his spiritual life, remembering that he had already been 
freed by Jesus Christ...

When we feel confused and overwhelmed by sin's appeal,
we need to follow Paul's example:

Thank God that He has given us freedom through Jesus Christ.
We need to let the reality of Christ's power to lift us up to real
victory over sin...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the power to 
overcome sin through Your Son Jesus Christ. Help 
me to remember to turn to Him each day when the
sin problem returns...Amen.

Keep looking up, for the power to overcome sin...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Therefore, there is no condemnation for those who are in Christ Jesus. (Romans 8:1) NIV
reflection: "Not guilty; let him go free." What would those words mean to you if you were on death row? The fact is that the whole human race is on death row, justly condemned for repeatedly breaking God's holy law. Without Jesus we would have no hope at all. But Thank God! He has declared us not guilty and has offered us freedom from sin and the power to do His will.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for paying the price in full for my sins on the cross. I know that without You I would have no hope. Help me to be sensitive to Your Holy Spirit's leading. I pray this in Jesus name. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Without Jesus there can be no hope...

Our Meditation for Today:
Therefore, there is no condemnation for those who
are in Christ Jesus...(Ro. 8:1) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

"Not guilty; let him go free." What would those words mean to you
if you were on death row?

The fact is that the whole human race is on death row, justly condemned
for repeatedly breaking God's holy law...

Without Jesus we would have no hope at all. But Thank God! He has 
declared us not guilty and has offered us freedom from sin and the power
to do His will...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for paying the price 
in full for my sins on the cross. I know that without You
I would have no hope. Help me to be sensitive to Your 
Holy Spirit's leading. I pray this in Jesus name...Amen.

Keep looking up, He is our only hope...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Through Jesus Christ the law of the Spirit of life set me free from the law of sin and death. (Romans 8:2) NIV
reflection: Of course we know that the life-giving Spirit is the Holy Spirit. As we see by (Genesis 1:2) he was present at the creation of the world and he is the power behind the rebirth of every Christian. He gives us the power we need to live the Christian life. If you wish to learn more about the Holy Spirit see John 3:6 Acts 1:3-5.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for the filling of the Holy Spirit. I pray that day by day I would become more sensitive and obedient to His leading. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~If we are still following our sinful nature we can never please God...

Our Meditation for Today:

Through Jesus Christ the law of the Spirit of life
set me free from the law of sin and death...(Ro 8:2) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Of course we know that the life-giving Spirit is the Holy Spirit...

As we see by (Gen. 1:2) he was present at the creation of the
world and he is the power behind the rebirth of every Christian...

He gives us the power we need to live the Christian life...

If you wish to learn more about the Holy Spirit see Jn. 3:6
Acts 1:3-5...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for the filling of the Holy Spirit.
I pray that day by day I would become more sensitive and
obedient to His leading...Amen.

Keep looking up, for His guiding hand...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather...

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: For what the law was powerless to do in that it was weakened by the sinful nature, God did by sending His Son in the likeness of sinful man to be a sin offering. And so He condemned sin in sinful man, in order that the righteous requirements of the law might be fully met in us, who do not live according to the sinful nature but according to the Spirit.
reflection: Yes Jesus gave Himself as a sacrifice for our sins. In the Old Testament times, animal sacrifices were continually offered at the temple. The sacrifices showed the Israelites the seriousness of sin~~ Blood had to be shed before sins could be pardoned. The animal sacrifice could not really remove sin. These sacrifices could only point to Jesus' sacrifice. Which paid the penalty for all sins.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the sacrifice You made for my sins. Forgive me for my sins today. Help me to walk a more Christ-like walk. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge...

Our Meditation for Today:

For what the law was powerless to do in that it was weakened by
the sinful nature, God did by sending His Son in the likeness of
sinful man to be a sin offering. And so He condemned sin in
sinful man,

in order that the righteous requirements of the law might be fully 
met in us, who do not live according to the sinful nature but 
according to the Spirit...

Our Thought for Today:

Yes Jesus gave Himself as a sacrifice for our sins.

In the Old Testament times, animal sacrifices were continually
offered at the temple. The sacrifices showed the Israelites the 
seriousness of sin~~

Blood had to be shed before sins could be pardoned...

The animal sacrifice could not really remove sin...
These sacrifices could only point to Jesus' sacrifice...
Which paid the penalty for all sins.

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the sacrifice You 
made for my sins. Forgive me for my sins today. Help
me to walk a more Christ-like walk...Amen.

Keep looking up, our salvation comes from above...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Those who live according to the sinful nature have their minds set on what nature desires; but those who live in accordance with the Spirit have their minds set on what the Spirit desires. The mind of sinful man is death, but the mind controlled be the Spirit is life and peace. (Romans 8:5, 6) NIV
reflection: Paul divides people into two categories: those who let themselves be controlled by their sinful nature, and those who follow after the Holy Spirit. All of us would be in the first category, if Jesus wouldn't have offered us a way out. Once we have said yes to Jesus, we will want to continue following Him, because His way bring life and peace. Daily we must consciously choose to center our life on God. Use the Bible to discover God's guidance, and then follow them. In every perplexing situation ask yourself, What would Jesus want me to do? When the Holy Spirit points out what is right, do it eagerly. . If you want more information on our sinful nature verses our new life in Christ, review (Romans 6:6-8; and turn to Eph. 4:22-24; Colossians 3:3-15).
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me to be sensitive to the Holy Spirit, so that I will follow His leading each and every day. I thank You for the guidance of Your Word for daily living. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Let the wise listen and add to their learning...

Our Meditation for Today:

Those who live according to the sinful nature have their minds 
set on what nature desires; but those who live in accordance 
with the Spirit have their minds set on what the Spirit desires.

The mind of sinful man is death, but the mind controlled be the 
Spirit is life and peace...(Ro. 8:5, 6) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Paul divides people into two categories: those who let themselves be
controlled by their sinful nature, and those who follow after the Holy Spirit.

All of us would be in the first category, if Jesus wouldn't have offered 
us a way out...

Once we have said yes to Jesus, we will want to continue following Him,
because His way bring life and peace...

Daily we must consciously choose to center our life on God. Use the 
Bible to discover God's guidance, and then follow them...

In every perplexing situation ask yourself, What would Jesus want me
to do? When the Holy Spirit points out what is right, do it eagerly....

If you want more information on our sinful nature verses our new life
in Christ, review (Ro. 6:6-8; and turn to Eph. 4:22-24; Col. 3:3-15).

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, help me to be sensitive to the Holy Spirit,
so that I will follow His leading each and every day. I thank You
for the guidance of Your Word for daily living...Amen.

Keep looking up, He wants to be your guide...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Those controlled by the sinful nature cannot please God. You, however, are controlled not by the sinful nature but by the Spirit, if the Spirit of God lives in you. And if anyone does not have the Spirit of Christ, he does not belong to Christ. (Romans 8:8, 9) NIV
reflection: Have you ever worried about whether or not you really are a Christian? A Christian is anyone who has the Spirit of God living in him or her. If you have sincerely trusted Christ for your salvation and acknowledged Him as Lord, then the Holy Spirit lives within you and you are a Christian. You can be assured that you have the Holy Spirit because Jesus promised that He would send Him. Since you now believe that Jesus Christ is God's Son and that eternal life comes through Him (I John 5:5) you will begin to act as Christ directs (Romans 8:5; Galatians 5:22, 23); you will find help in your daily problems and in your praying (Romans 8:26, 27). You will be empowered to serve God and do His will (Acts 1:8; Romans 12:6ff; and you will become part of God's plan to build up His church (Eph. 4:12, 13)
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for these assurances that are mine by you presence in my life. Make me mindful of this each and every day. Forgive me when I stumble. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~"Fools despise wisdom and discipline"...

Our Meditation for Today:

Those controlled by the sinful nature cannot please God...

You, however, are controlled not by the sinful nature but 
by the Spirit, if the Spirit of God lives in you. And if anyone 
does not have the Spirit of Christ, he does not belong to Christ...
(Ro. 8:8, 9) NIV

Our Thought for Today:
Have you ever worried about whether or not you really are a
Christian? A Christian is anyone who has the Spirit of God
living in him or her...

If you have sincerely trusted Christ for your salvation and
acknowledged Him as Lord, then the Holy Spirit lives within
you and you are a Christian...

You can be assured that you have the Holy Spirit because
Jesus promised that He would send Him. Since you now 
believe that Jesus Christ is God's Son and that eternal life
comes through Him (I Jn. 5:5) you will begin to act as Christ 
directs (Ro. 8:5; Gal. 5:22, 23); you will find help in your
daily problems and in your praying (Ro.8:26, 27)...

You will be empowered to serve God and do His will (Acts
1:8; Ro. 12:6ff; and you will become part of God's plan
to build up His church (Eph. 4:12, 13)

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for these assurances that
are mine by you presence in my life. Make me mindful of this
each and every day. Forgive me when I stumble...Amen.

Keep looking up, He is our light...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Therefore, brothers we have an obligation, but it is not to the sinful nature, to live according to it. For if you live according to the sinful nature, you will die; but if by the Spirit you put to death the misdeeds of the body, you will live. (Romans 8:12-13) NIV
reflection: When we turn away from sin's appeal by the Holy Spirit's power, regarding sin as dead, we can ignore/overcome temptation when it comes. Lets review what Paul wrote in (Romans 6:10, 11). He, Jesus, died once to defeat sin, and now He lives for the glory of God. So you should consider yourselves dead to sin and able to live for the glory of God through Christ Jesus. What Paul is saying is that we should regard our old sinful nature as dead and unresponsive to sin~~that is if we identify ourselves with Christ. If and when we started a new life in Christ, the Holy Spirit is there to help us become all Christ wants us to be.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I do confess that my greatest wish is to become more like Christ, however, the old nature keeps creeping back. Forgive me for stumbling, and falling short of all You want me to be. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~The Lord is our shield and protects the way of His faithful ones.

Our Meditation for Today:

Therefore, brothers we have an obligation, but it is 
not to the sinful nature, to live according to it...

For if you live according to the sinful nature, you will die; 
but if by the Spirit you put to death the misdeeds of the body, 
you will live...(Ro. 8:12-13) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

When we turn away from sin's appeal by the Holy Spirit's power,
regarding sin as dead, we can ignore/overcome temptation when 
it comes...

Lets review what Paul wrote in (Ro. 6:10, 11).

He, Jesus, died once to defeat sin, and now He lives for the glory
of God. So you should consider yourselves dead to sin and able
to live for the glory of God through Christ Jesus...

What Paul is saying is that we should regard our old sinful nature
as dead and unresponsive to sin~~that is if we identify ourselves 
with Christ...

If and when we started a new life in Christ, the Holy Spirit is there
to help us become all Christ wants us to be...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I do confess that my greatest wish
is to become more like Christ, however, the old nature keeps
creeping back. Forgive me for stumbling, and falling short
of all You want me to be...Amen.

Keep looking up, He wants to guide you in paths of righteousness...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Those who are led by the Spirit of God are sons of God. For you did not receive a spirit that makes you a slave again to fear, but you received the Spirit of sonship. And by Him we cry "Abba Father." The Spirit Himself testifies with our spirit that we are God's children. Now if we are children, then we are heirs, heirs of God and coheirs with Christ, if indeed we share in His sufferings in order that we may also share in His glory. (Romans 8:14-17) NIV
reflection: Paul uses adoption to illustrate the believers 'new' relationship with God. In the Roman culture, the adopted person lost all rights to his old family and gained all the rights of a legitimate child in his new family. He became a full heir to his new father's estate. It is the same for a new believer, he or she gains all the privileges and responsibilities of a child in God's family. One of these outstanding privileges is being led by the Spirit (see Galatians 4:5, 6). We may not always feel like we belong to God, but the Holy Spirit is our witness. His inward presence reminds us of who we are and encourages us with God's love (Romans 5:5).
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for what is mine through my personal relationship with You. Guide and direct my life today so that I will be a better witness for You. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Wisdom will save you from the ways of the wicked...

Our Meditation for Today:

Those who are led by the Spirit of God are sons of God...

For you did not receive a spirit that makes you a slave
again to fear, but you received the Spirit of sonship.
And by Him we cry "Abba Father."

The Spirit Himself testifies with our spirit that we are 
God's children...

Now if we are children, then we are heirs, heirs of God
and coheirs with Christ, if indeed we share in His sufferings
in order that we may also share in His glory...(Ro. 8:14-17) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Paul uses adoption to illustrate the believers 'new' relationship
with God. In the Roman culture, the adopted person lost all
rights to his old family and gained all the rights of a legitimate
child in his new family...

He became a full heir to his new father's estate...

It is the same for a new believer, he or she gains all the
privileges and responsibilities of a child in God's family...

One of these outstanding privileges is being led by the 
Spirit (see Gal. 4:5, 6).

We may not always feel like we belong to God, but the Holy Spirit
is our witness. His inward presence reminds us of who we are and
encourages us with God's love (Ro. 5:5)...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for what is mine through
my personal relationship with You. Guide and direct my life
today so that I will be a better witness for You...Amen.

Keep looking up, He wants to lead you through your difficulties...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: What we suffer now is nothing compared to the glory He will give us later. For all creation is waiting eagerly for that future day when God will reveal who His children really are. Against its will, everything on earth was subject to God's curse. All earth's creation anticipates the day when it will join God's children in glorious freedom from death and decay. For we know that all creation has been groaning as in the pains of childbirth right up to the present time. (Romans 8:18-22) NLT
reflection: Sin has caused all creation to fall from the perfect state in which God created it. the world is in bondage to death and decay so that it can not fulfill its intended purpose. One day all creation will be liberated and transformed. But until that time we wait in eager expectation for the resurrection of God's children.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I know the state of my being, yet even so You promise to hear my prayers, and so I come today asking again Your forgiveness for my many sins and I thank You that You promise to forgive and remember them no more and that You will throw them as far as the east is from the west. Keep our nation, its citizens and our troops safe. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Knowing God's will for you will save you 
from the ways of the wicked...

Our Meditation for Today:

What we suffer now is nothing compared to the glory He will give us later.

For all creation is waiting eagerly for that future day when God will reveal
who His children really are...

Against its will, everything on earth was subject to God's curse...

All earth's creation anticipates the day when it will join God's children in
glorious freedom from death and decay...

For we know that all creation has been groaning as in the pains of childbirth
right up to the present time...(Ro. 8:18-22) NLT

Our Thought for Today:

Sin has caused all creation to fall from the perfect state in which God created it.
the world is in bondage to death and decay so that it can not fulfill its intended
purpose...

One day all creation will be liberated and transformed. But until that time we wait
in eager expectation for the resurrection of God's children...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I know the state of my being,
yet even so You promise to hear my prayers, and
so I come today asking again Your forgiveness for
my many sins and I thank You that You promise to
forgive and remember them no more and that You
will throw them as far as the east is from the west.
Keep our nation, its citizens and our troops safe...Amen.

Keep looking up, and He will keep blessing you...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: (here is the follow up to yesterdays devotion: Not only so, but we ourselves, who have the first fruits of the Spirit, groan inwardly as we wait eagerly for our adoption as sons, the redemption of our bodies. For in this hope we were saved. but hope that is seen is no hope at all. Who hopes for what he already has??? But if we hope for what we do not yet have, we wait for it patiently. (Romans 8:23-25) NIV
reflection: It should be natural for children to trust their parents, eventhough parents sometimes fail to keep their promises, Our Heavenly Father, however, never makes promises He won't keep. But we need to remember His timing is different from ours, so His plan may take longer than we expect. So instead of acting like impatient children as we wait for God's will to unfold, we need to have confidence in God's perfect timing and wisdom.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me when I pray for a special need and I grow impatient while waiting for an answer. I often forget that Your timing is much better than mine, as You know all things. Help me to always wait patiently. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding...

Our Meditation for Today:

(here is the follow up to yesterdays devotion:

Not only so, but we ourselves, who have the first fruits of the Spirit,
groan inwardly as we wait eagerly for our adoption as sons, the 
redemption of our bodies...

For in this hope we were saved. but hope that is seen is no hope at all. 
Who hopes for what he already has???

But if we hope for what we do not yet have, we wait for it patiently...
(Ro 8:23-25) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

It should be natural for children to trust their parents, eventhough
parents sometimes fail to keep their promises, Our Heavenly
Father, however, never makes promises He won't keep...

But we need to remember His timing is different from ours, so
His plan may take longer than we expect. So instead of acting like 
impatient children as we wait for God's will to unfold, we need to 
have confidence in God's perfect timing and wisdom...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me when I pray for a special
need and I grow impatient while waiting for an answer. I often
forget that Your timing is much better than mine, as You know
all things. Help me to always wait patiently...Amen.

Keep looking up, He is only a prayer away...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: In the same way, the Spirit helps us in our weakness. We do not know what we ought to pray for, but the Spirit Himself intercedes for us with groans that words cannot express. And He who searches our hearts knows the mind of the Spirit, because the Spirit intercedes for the saints in accordance with God's will. (Romans 8:26, 27) NIV
reflection: As a believer, you are not left to your own resources to cope with problems. Even when you don't know the right words to pray, the Holy Spirit prays with and for you, and God answers. With God helping you pray, you don't need to be afraid to come before Him. Ask the Holy Spirit to intercede for you "in harmony with God's own will." Then when you bring your request to God, trust that He will always do what is best.
prayer: I thank You for the Holy Spirit's presence. I thank You for His intercession on my behalf. I have to confess that there have been many times that I just didn't have the words I needed, to express myself as I had wished. I thank you that I need not cope with my problems alone. I pray that my faith will grow to the point that I will always trust that You will do what is best. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought) Do not be wise in your own eyes, 
fear the Lord and shun evil. (Pro. 3:7)

Our Meditation for Today:

In the same way, the Spirit helps us in our weakness.
We do not know what we ought to pray for, but the Spirit
Himself intercedes for us with groans that words cannot
express.

And He who searches our hearts knows the mind of the 
Spirit, because the Spirit intercedes for the saints in 
accordance with God's will...(Ro. 8:26, 27) NIV

The Lesson To Be Learned:

As a believer, you are not left to your own resources to cope with problems...

Even when you don't know the right words to pray, the Holy Spirit prays with
and for you, and God answers...

With God helping you pray, you don't need to be afraid to come before Him.

Ask the Holy Spirit to intercede for you "in harmony with God's own will."
Then when you bring your request to God, trust that He will always do
what is best...

Our Prayer for Today:
I thank You for the Holy Spirit's presence. I thank You for
His intercession on my behalf. I have to confess that there
have been many times that I just didn't have the words I
needed, to express myself as I had wished. I thank you that
I need not cope with my problems alone. I pray that my faith
will grow the the point that I will always trust that You will do
what is best...Amen

Keep looking up, He is only a prayer away...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
